metadata.title: CVE-2021-47340 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: jfs:fix GPF in diFree Avoid passing inode with JFS_SBI(inode->i_sb)->ipimap ==NULL to diFree()[1]. GFP will appear: struct inode *ipimap =JFS_SBI(ip->i_sb)->ipimap; struct inomap *imap = JFS_IP(ipimap)->i_imap;JFS_IP() will return invalid pointer when ipimap == NULL Call Trace:diFree+0x13d/0x2dc0 fs/jfs/jfs_imap.c:853 [1] jfs_evict_inode+0x2c9/0x370fs/jfs/inode.c:154 evict+0x2ed/0x750 fs/inode.c:578 iput_finalfs/inode.c:1654 [inline] iput.part.0+0x3fe/0x820 fs/inode.c:1680iput+0x58/0x70 fs/inode.c:1670

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-lowlatency - 4.4.0-234.268
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-kvm - 4.4.0-1114.124
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1151-aws - 4.4.0-1151.166
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-gcp - 4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-oracle - 4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-234.268').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.124').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
